dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 332 IH: To amend the National Marine Sanctuaries Act to prescribe an additional requirement for the designation of marine sanctuaries off the coast of Alaska.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Young of Alaska introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the National Marine Sanctuaries Act to prescribe an additional requirement for the designation of marine sanctuaries off the coast of Alaska.

section.header: Limitation on authority to designate marine sanctuaries
section.text: Section 303 of the National Marine Sanctuaries Act (16 U.S.C. 1433) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking The Secretary may and inserting Subject to subsection (c), the Secretary may; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary may not designate as a national marine sanctuary any area of the marine environment off the coast of Alaska seaward of the high tide line unless an Act of Congress—

paragraph.text: requires the Secretary to make such a designation; and
prescribes the boundaries of the area to be given such designation by the Secretary.
